actions-list.actionItem: The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H. Res. 363.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Fitzgerald moved to suspend the rules and agree to the resolution, as amended. H. Res. 363 — "Expressing support for recognizing "National Police Week"."

At the conclusion of debate, the Yeas and Nays were demanded and ordered. Pursuant to the provisions of clause 8, rule XX, the Chair announced that further proceedings on the motion would be postponed.
The House resumed debate on H.R. 3089.
The House received a message from the Senate. The Senate passed S.J. Res. 23, and S.J. Res. 24. Senate agreed to H. Con. Res. 35.
The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 3089.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
Mr. Fitzgerald moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill. H.R. 3089 — "To amend title 18, United States Code, to modify delayed notice requirements, and for other purposes."
The Speaker announced that votes on suspensions, if ordered, will be postponed until a time to be announced.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of May 15.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is subject to the call of the Chair.
The House proceeded with one minute speeches.
The Chair designated Mr. Wilson of SC to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.

The Chair announced that he had examined the Journal of the last day's proceedings and had approved it. Ms. Kim (CA) demanded that the question be put on agreeing to the Speaker's approval of the Journal and by voice vote, the Chair announced that the ayes had prevailed. Ms. Kim (CA) objected to the voice vote based upon the absence of a quorum and the Chair postponed further proceedings on the question of agreeing to the Speaker's approval of the Journal until a time to be announced.
Today's prayer was offered by the House Chaplain, Chaplain Margaret Grun Kibben.
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of May 15.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is scheduled for 2:00 P.M. today.
The House proceeded with Morning-Hour Debate. At the conclusion of Morning-Hour, the House will recess until 2:00 p.m. for the start of legislative business.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Erin Houchin to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
